intro: Habenaria flagellans, commonly known as the flagellate orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique floral structure and pollination mechanism make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
